com.thindeck.api

Interface Step

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DockerRun, DockerStop, FindTanks, MkStep, ReadConfig, Swap, UpdateLB

    @Immutable
public interface Step
    Step in a Task.

    A step is called by Txn, when it has control of a task. A call is made either to exec(Context), commit(Context) or rollback(Context). This depends on the situation with the transaction. This decision is made only by the transaction. The step is a passive component in this sense.

    A step should try to finish its execution as soon as possible, preferably in less than a few milliseconds. If more time is required, it should throw Txn.ReRunException and expect a new call in a few minutes.

    Read more about our two-phase commit protocol in Txn.

    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Yegor Bugayenko (yegor@tpc2.com)
